snippet: A labor lawyer and a journalist were arrested, raising concerns among human rights activists that the military-backed government is sweeping up critics of its policies.
abstract: Egyptian labor lawyer Haitham Mohammadain and journalist Ahmed Abu-Draa are arrested, raising concerns among human rights activist that Egyptian government's crackdown on Islamists is also sweeping up critics of its policies.
lead_paragraph: A labor lawyer and a journalist were arrested, raising concerns among human rights activists that the military-backed government is sweeping up critics of its policies.

headline.main: Egypt: Military Arrests Lawyer and Reporter in Widening Sweeps
headline.print_headline: Egypt: Military Arrests Lawyer And Reporter in Widening Sweeps
